summary: This document is an email chain from December 2020 between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi Sternheim, and an Assistant United States Attorney, concerning urgent requests for daily video teleconferences (VTCs) for Maxwell while she was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It highlights logistical challenges and the defense's need to review voluminous discovery with their client ahead of court deadlines.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated client of attorney Bobbi Sternheim. The emails concern urgent requests for daily video teleconferences (VTCs) for her to review discovery documents while in quarantine at MDC.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office and MDC staff to arrange daily legal VTCs for her client, citing voluminous discovery and court deadlines.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge before whom a filing was made, stating Maxwell would continue to receive daily legal calls converted to VTCs during lockdown.

persons.name: Ms. Papapcim
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Mr. Wallace as having informed the Court that Maxwell was provided one video call.

persons.name: Mr. Wallace
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Ms. Papapcim as having informed the Court that Maxwell was provided one video call.

connections.description: Sternheim is actively advocating for Maxwell's access to legal VTCs to review discovery, demonstrating the formal defense attorney relationship.
Sternheim references a filing made to Judge Nathan regarding Maxwell's access to legal communications, indicating an attorney-court relationship.

events.title: Failed VTC Attempt
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was provided one video teleconference call which failed due to audio problems.

events.title: COVID-19 Outbreak at MDC
events.description: An outbreak of COVID-19 at the Metropolitan Detention Center led to the suspension of in-person legal visits for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Urgent Request for VTC Confirmation
events.description: An AUSA follows up on a prior filing, requesting confirmation that Maxwell will receive a VTC or legal call that day, as promised to the court.

locations: New York, NY 10011 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 33 West 19th Street)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in December 2020, held in isolation/quarantine due to a COVID-19 outbreak.
Her defense attorney, Bobbi Sternheim, was urgently requesting daily video teleconferences (VTCs) to review millions of pages of discovery, citing upcoming court deadlines.
The defense had represented to Judge Nathan that Maxwell would receive daily legal VTCs, but on December 21, 2020, she was initially informed she had no legal calls scheduled.
A prior VTC attempt on August 18, 2020, had failed due to audio problems, and the defense claimed VTCs were generally unavailable on the 'East SHU' (Special Housing Unit).
The correspondence reveals significant logistical challenges and communication issues between the defense, the U.S. Attorney's office, and the detention facility regarding client access.
